artifact.content: The system will need to keep track of available resources.
Check if caller and callee are permitted to make and answer phone calls respectively.
Dial tone sent to caller if resources are available to make a phone call.
Caller is sent an idle tone while dialing.
Phone numbers are four digits long.

After picking up the receiver, the caller must finish dialing the phone number before a certain period of time. In addition, the caller has a limited amount of time between dialling successive digits. Failure to meet the above conditions results in a Dial Timeout, and the caller is sent a fast busy tone.
Caller dials a non-existent phone number.
If the callee is off-hook, caller is sent a slow busy tone.
When caller dials a valid number, caller�s phone is sent a ring tone and callee�s phone rings.
The callee must answer within a certain period of time, otherwise the caller is sent a fast busy tone and callee�s phone stops ringing.
When a call is terminated from either side, the other user is sent a fast busy tone
Allow administrators to login to the System Console using the assigned username and password.
Allow current administrators to assign and update administrator privileges.
In order to create a user account, an administrator must be able to find an unassigned phone number.
In order to create a user account, an administrator must be able to find an unassigned IP address.
Allow administrators to create and cancel user accounts (includes assigning a billing plan, updating status of user, call privileges, and account balance, and add/remove IP-phone number mapping).
Administrator must be able to create a new class of service.
Administrator must be able to create (incl. assign services) and edit a billing plan.
Administrators must be able to view current status of the system.
Administrators must be able to conduct a connectivity test to ensure that a user�s phone is connected to the system at their request
If a new or repaired device is added to the system, the administrator may request to enable the device
Need to disable a phone for repairs or replacement
Allow administrator to reset a particular phone if it is deadlocked.
An alert to the administrator via the System Console when there is an error or when returning results of a hardware test.
Periodically executing a hardware fault detection test.
Administrator should be allowed set a value for the maximum allowable number of calls.
Administrators should be allowed to generate and send billing invoices.
The system should be able to automatically generate and send billing invoices.
Callers and callees should be able to use the system without knowledge of the underlying logic.
If a connection is established, the caller will be connected to the expected callee.
The conversations over this system are secure, and will not be overheard by any party other than the caller and callee.
Failure of a telephone will not affect the remaining phones connected to the system.
Callers should be able to make calls at all times.
If the number of users increases, the system will continue to function smoothly in spite of the additional volume.
The system will be designed such that it can be easily extended to support new features.
Upon lifting the receiver to make a call, the caller will hear a dial tone within a specific period of time.
